contest-event.event-date:
June 30, 1877 D Huddersfield Contest
Huddersfield North Ward Conservative Association Contest 0 Own Choice Test Piece Contest
huddersfield-contest
Test Piece Contest
Semiramide [unknown arranger]
Greenhead Park, Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, England, UK Prizes: £25, £18, £12, £8, £4
22 bands entered - 14 competed
There was also a quick-step contest, in which there were four prizes given. Each band under its conductor was allowed to play a grand march of its own choice. The judge was Mr. Henry Jackson, Windermere, and the prizes as given were: Honley, 1st prize, conductor, John Berry ; Boarshurst (Saddleworth), 2nd, conductor, John Radcliffe; 31st Lancashire Rifle Volunteers, 3rd, conductor, E. Swift ; Stocksbridge, 4th, conductor, John Berry
Jan. 3, 2012, 3:24 p.m. March 30, 2017, 12:24 p.m.
